title.div: The Council Tax (Liability for Owners) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau'r Dreth Gyngor (Atebolrwydd Perchenogion) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations are made under sections 8(1) and 113(1) of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 (“the 1992 Act”) and amend the Council Tax (Liability for Owners) Regulations 1992 (“the 1992 Regulations”).

Caiff y Rheoliadau hyn eu gwneud o dan adrannau 8(1) a 113(1) o Ddeddf Cyllid Llywodraeth Leol 1992 (“Deddf 1992”) ac maent yn diwygio Rheoliadau'r Dreth Gyngor (Atebolrwydd Perchenogion) 1992 (“Rheoliadau 1992”).

entry.title: The Community Legal Service (Financial) (Amendment) Regulations 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Community Legal Service (Financial) Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/516) which govern the financial aspects of the provision of services funded by the Legal Services Commission.

entry.title: The Police Pensions Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police Pensions Regulations 1987 (“the 1987 Regulations”) as they apply in Scotland.

entry.title: The Plant Health (Phytophthora ramorum) (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 2nd December 2004, implements in Scotland–

entry.title: The Swinford Hospital (Designation as having a Religious Character) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order designates Old Swinford Hospital as a school having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults (Commencement No. 1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation those Articles of the Protection of Children and Vulnerable Adults (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 which will permit the Department of Health, Social Services and Public Safety to seek observations from those currently listed by that Department on the Pre-Employment Consultancy Service Register and from those organisations that referred them for inclusion on that Register.

entry.title: The International Fund for Agricultural Development (Sixth Replenishment) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order approves the making of a payment on behalf of the Government of the United Kingdom of a sum not exceeding £19,707,000 as a contribution to the resources of the International Fund for Agricultural Development in accordance with the arrangements made pursuant to the Resolution entitled “the Resolution 130/XXVI of the Governing Council of the Fund on the Sixth Replenishment of the Fund’s resources”, adopted on 19th February 2003.

entry.title: The A50 Trunk Road (Queensway Roundabout to Heron Cross Roundabout) Order 2004
entry.summary: This version of the The A50 Trunk Road (Queensway Roundabout to Heron Cross Roundabout) Order 2004 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Controls on Certain Azo Dyes and Blue Colourant (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to Commission Directive 2004/21/EC relating to Restrictions on the Marketing and Use of ‘azo colourants’ (thirteenth adaptation to technical progress of Council Directive 76/769/EEC) (O.J. No. L57, 25.2.2004, p.4).

entry.title: The Gas (Applications for Licences and Extensions and Restrictions of Licences) (No. 2) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the information, and other documents that are required to be submitted with applications for gas transporter, gas shipper, gas supplier and gas interconnector licences (and for extensions or restrictions of supplier, shipper and transporter licences) under the Gas Act 1986, as amended by the Utilities Act 2000 and the Energy Act 2004. They specify the form and manner of such applications. These Regulations also set out the manner in which notices of applications are to be published.

entry.title: The Electricity (Applications for Licences, Modifications of an Area and Extensions and Restrictions of Licences) (No. 2) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the information, and other documents that are required to be submitted with applications for electricity generation, transmission, distribution, supply and interconnector licences (and for modifications of an area of transmission licences and extensions, or restrictions of supply and distribution licences) under the Electricity Act 1989, as amended by the Utilities Act 2000 and the Energy Act 2004. They specify the form and manner of such applications. These Regulations also set out the manner in which notices of applications are to be published.

entry.title: The Fines (Deductions from Income Support)(Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Fines (Deductions from Income Support) Regulations 1992 (S.I. 1992/2182) (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Diseases of Animals (Approved Disinfectants) (Amendment) (England) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order, which applies to England only, amends the Diseases of Animals (Approved Disinfectants) Order 1978, revokes earlier amendment Orders and comes into force on 1st December 2004. It substitutes for Schedules 1 and 2 to the 1978 Order the Schedules set out in this Order. Schedule 1 lists disinfectants approved by the Secretary of State and Schedule 2 lists disinfectants which, although no longer approved, may continue to be used as approved disinfectants until 28th February 2005.

entry.title: Valuation (Natural Gas Undertaking) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations provide that specified property used for the conveyance of gas, occupied or, if unoccupied, owned by Phoenix Natural Gas Limited or by BGE (UK) Limited which would, apart from these Regulations, be more than one hereditament shall be treated as one hereditament.

entry.title: The Food Protection (Emergency Prohibitions) (Amnesic Shellfish Poisoning) (West Coast) (No. 13) (Scotland) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order, which forms part of Scots law only, contains emergency prohibitions restricting various activities in order to prevent human consumption of food rendered unsuitable for that purpose by virtue of shellfish having been affected by the toxin which causes amnesic shellfish poisoning in human beings.

entry.title: Act of Adjournal (Criminal Procedure Rules Amendment No. 5) (Miscellaneous) 2004
entry.summary: This Act of Adjournal makes various amendments to the Criminal Procedure Rules 1996 (S.I. 1996/513) (“the 1996 Rules”).

entry.title: The Mallaig Harbour Revision Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order empowers the Mallaig Harbour Authority to construct and maintain a breakwater at Mallaig.

entry.title: A63 Trunk Road (M1 Junction with A63 Selby Road to A1 Milford Lodge) (Detrunking) Order 2004
entry.summary: This version of the A63 Trunk Road (M1 Junction with A63 Selby Road to A1 Milford Lodge) (Detrunking) Order 2004 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Air Quality Limit Values (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations come into force on 3rd December 2004 and amend the Air Quality Limit Values Regulations (SI 2003/2121) (“the 2003 Regulations”).

entry.title: Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-enact with changes the Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2002 (S.R. 2002 No. 340) (as amended by S.R. 2003 No. 215).
